intro: Diflugossa glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular diflugossa, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive glandular structures on its leaves and stems. It belongs to the family Diflugossaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant exhibits a creeping growth habit with small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a subtle fragrance that attracts pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
